text:
I have an servlet application for uploading files.  As part of this, I call 
available() on the ServletInputStream to see how much I can read without 
blocking.  When running on other servlet engines (WebSphere, JServ, JRun), I am 
able to get a value back so that I can do my reads.  On Tomcat, I always get a 
0 because the available method was never implemented in any of the classes to 
inherit ServletInputStream so the call goes directly to java.io.InputStream 
which states that "This method should be overridden by subclasses."
